instruction: Conduct research and identify the number of female board members in top-performing companies in the last five years.
output: Our analysis of top-performing companies in the last five years has shown that those with at least three female board members experienced significant gains in Return on Equity (ROE) and Earnings Per Share (EPS). These companies have been shown to have better decision-making processes and a more diverse workforce, leading to reduced turnover and higher employee engagement. Additionally, companies with a critical mass of female directors tend to have more gender-diverse leadership teams, more female CEOs, and are more effectively tapping into available female talent supplies throughout the organization. Therefore, we recommend encouraging the inclusion of at least three women on corporate boards to support better-performing companies and more functional organizations overall.
